bug.author: tranorrepository
bug.description: Training Mask RCNN encounter error below: File "./tensorpack/examples/FasterRCNN/data.py", line 208, in preprocess fname, boxes, klass, is_crowd = img['file_name'], img['boxes'], img['class'], img['is_crowd'] KeyError: 'file_name' and then the training process get stuck at "Pre-filling staging area...â€œ My environment: python 3.4, tf 1.4, cuda 8.0.

comments.comment: Please follow the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ppwwyyxx/tensorpack/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE.md>issue template</denchmark-link> to report problems. I think you didn't use a valid COCO annotation file.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ppwwyyxx>@ppwwyyxx</denchmark-link>
COCO annotations are download from <denchmark-link:http://cocodataset.org/#home>http://cocodataset.org/#home</denchmark-link>
print the img, {..., b'license': 4, b'file_name': b'../data/COCO/train2014/COCO_train2014_000000158420.jpg'} when I modified the img['file_name'] to img[b'file_name'], the error disappear.
There is no b if I print it. It may be due to some difference in python version or its json implementation.
After a thought I think it's due to how msgpack serializes/deserializes the data. What's you msgpack version and could you perhaps upgrade it?
My msgpack is 0.4.8, it seems to be the latest.
Turned out that msgpack always transforms strings to bytes. Should be fixed now.
